description.narrative: Distribute hygiene kits and hygiene promotion

Zambia is facing cholera outbreak. Cases of the outbreak were reported in October but the situation has escalated in the month of December 2017 and January, 2018.
Through the Ministry of Health, a Statutory Instrument has been evoked to ensure that the spread of the outbreak and loss of life is prevented. The re-opening of the schools countrywide was deferred and public gatherings banned.
WHO risk assessment shows that the current outbreak is occurring in Zambia’s largest city, Lusaka. The main affected wards in Lusaka district are, Chipata and Kanyama, which are densely populated and have an inadequate water and sanitation infrastructure, which may favor the spread of the disease. The sources of infection transmission in this outbreak have been associated with contaminated water supplies, contaminated food, inadequate sanitation and poor hygiene practices.
WHO in collaboration with the Government-Ministry of Health have commenced vaccination campaign on 10th January, 2018. Planning is underway to vaccinate a further 1 million people living in known cholera hotspots across the country later this year
Though some areas are reporting reduction of new cases especially in areas already receiving support, the update by the Minister of Health dated yesterday 16th January, reported 16 new cases in George Compound ward in Lusaka.
